author: Yuko Takeo, Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan’s Farm Minister resigned Wednesday after saying over the weekend that he’s never bought rice, drawing criticism at a time when the government is facing heat for rising food prices.
title: Japan’s Farm Minister Eto Resigns Following Comments on Rice

author: Joe Mayes
description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves will hold talks with US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent this week, as the two countries continue to finalize the details of an agreement to cut tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump’s administration.
title: Reeves to Meet Bessent as Questions Linger Over UK-US Deal

author: Tom Redmond, Niki Koswanage, Jin Wu
description: Allegations against former Malaysian prime minister are in 2024 court document. Prosecutors haven’t recommended that Najib stands trial.
title: French Prosecutors Claim Najib Had Role in 2002 Submarine Deal Bribes

author: Andrea Navarro, Maya Averbuch, Alex Vasquez
description: In the vast swaths of Mexico controlled by drug cartels, public executions and mass graves have long been the norm. Mexico City has largely been a haven from the goriest headlines.
title: Bloody Murders in Quiet Neighborhood Shatter Mexico City’s Calm

author: Anthony Capaccio, Catherine Lucey
description: President Donald Trump vowed that a “Golden Dome” missile-defense shield would be “fully operational” by the end of his term, and offer the US protection from an array of threats — even though some of the technology remains unproven.
title: Trump Says Golden Dome Will Be Operational in Three Years

author: Ntando Thukwana, S'thembile Cele
description: South African Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana’s third attempt to deliver a budget represents his sternest test yet.
title: South Africa’s Budget Gets Third Reboot With Credibility on Line

author: Emma Sanchez
description: The UK sanctioned an English accountant for allegedly helping Russia expand the fleet of tankers it uses to covertly ship crude around the globe.
title: UK Sanctions British Accountant for Alleged Russia Ship Deals

author: Joshua Green
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Bloomberg Businessweek national correspondent Joshua Green looks at the revelations in a new book about how former President Joe Biden’s family and staff hid his decline while in office. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: ‘Original Sin’ Lays Out How Biden’s Decline Was Hidden by Family, Staff

author: Alicia A. Caldwell
description: President Donald Trump has vowed to carry out the largest deportation campaign in US history, a promise that mirrors one he made but failed to fulfill during his first term. This time, Trump has shown greater determination.
title: Trump Promised Record Deportations. How’s That Going?

author: Patrick Van Oosterom, Sarah Jacob
description: The Netherlands estimates it will need to boost defense spending by as much as €19 billion ($21.4 billion) a year to meet the expected new target for the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.
title: Dutch Government Needs to Spend Up to €19 Billion More to Meet NATO Target

author: Nick Wadhams
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth announced a new probe into the 2021 Afghanistan withdrawal, vowing accountability for what he called the Biden administration’s “disastrous and embarrassing” handling of the events that led to the deaths of 13 US troops.
title: Hegseth Starts Fresh Probe Into ‘Disastrous’ Afghanistan Pullout

author: David Gura, Naomi Shavin
description: Today on the Big Take: Editor at large for Bloomberg Weekend Mishal Husain interviews Elon Musk at the Qatar Economic Forum.
title: Listen: Bloomberg’s Elon Musk Interview In-Full

author: Eric Martin, Ryan Chua
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio suggested President Donald Trump wouldn’t join a meeting of Group of 20 leaders in South Africa later this year, saying the country has been “consistently unaligned” with US policy.
title: Trump Won’t Participate in G-20 in South Africa, Rubio Says

author: Allyson Versprille
description: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said the US Federal Aviation Administration will release a plan today to reduce flights at Newark airport after systems outages and a staffing crunch pushed the agency to slow traffic over the last several weeks.
title: Newark Airport Flight Reduction Plan Coming Today, Duffy Says

author: Ewa Krukowska
description: The European Union is likely to propose a quota as the mechanism to enforce a bloc-wide import ban on Russian gas by the end of 2027, which officials say should provide companies with a legal basis to terminate long-term purchase contracts.
title: EU Likely to Propose Quota to Ban Russia Gas Imports by End 2027

author: Martha Viotti Beck, Simone Iglesias
description: Not long ago, Brazil’s finance chief was a rising star in the government of President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva. Now, factors beyond Fernando Haddad’s control have put his political ambitions on hold.
title: Brazil Finance Chief Pivots as Lula Lingers in the Limelight

author: Daniel Flatley, Erik Hertzberg, Laura Dhillon Kane, Kamil Kowalcze
description: When Germany’s Angela Merkel was photographed at the 2018 Group of Seven meeting, surrounded by others and leaning over a cross-armed Donald Trump, the image was seen as a public display of world leaders pushing back against a disruptive US president.
title: G-7 Finance Ministers Aim to Avoid Public Spats With US Despite Trade Turmoil

author: Maxwell Adler
description: Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass signed an executive order aimed at revitalizing the local film and television industry by making it easier to obtain production permits — a task currently managed by a city- and county-backed office called FilmLA.
title: LA Mayor Signs Order Aiming to Boost Local Film, TV Production

author: Michael Cohen
description: Land ownership remains an explosive issue in South Africa more than three decades after White-minority rule ended. It’s also at the center of a diplomatic row with the US, as President Donald Trump and his Pretoria-born billionaire ally Elon Musk falsely claim that the South African government is engaging in land grabs and that there’s a genocide against White Afrikaner farmers.
title: Why South Africa’s Land Law Is at Heart of Trump Row

author: Anna Shiryaevskaya
description: The European Union imposed sanctions on three vessels that helped move gas cargoes from Russia’s Yamal LNG project, further squeezing Moscow’s energy revenues.
title: EU Sanctions Ships That Helped Move Gas From Russia’s Yamal LNG

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: Spain will host a meeting of foreign ministers from the European Union and the Arab world in Madrid on May 25 as it seeks to ramp up diplomatic pressure on Israel to halt its latest offensive in Gaza.
title: Spain to Host Arab-EU Summit on May 25 to Discuss Gaza War

author: Eric Martin, Natalia Drozdiak
description: President Donald Trump thinks Russia will likely walk away from Ukraine peace talks if the US threatens more sanctions, according to his top diplomat, supporting the White House’s decision not to pressure Moscow despite its resistance to a ceasefire.
title: Sanctions Risk Pushing Russia Away From Peace Talks, Rubio Says

author: S'thembile Cele
description: South Africa’s National Treasury is considering raising additional borrowing in its latest rendition of the budget, to be delivered on Wednesday, to cover a revenue shortfall after a plan to increase taxes was scrapped.
title: South Africa Weighs More Borrowing After Tax Hike Plan Dropped

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Laura Nahmias, Josh Saul
description: The Trump administration is allowing construction to resume on a $5 billion wind farm off Long Island after reaching a deal with New York Governor Kathy Hochul that could allow new natural gas pipelines to be built in the state.
title: Trump Reversed His NY Wind Farm Stance After Hochul Agreed to Pipelines

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Khalid Qayum
description: Pakistan promoted its army chief to field marshal to mark the country’s success in the most serious military confrontation with India in half a century this month.
title: Pakistan Promotes Army Chief After Conflict With India

author: Philip Aldrick, Leonard Kehnscherper
description: The UK government is planning to reduce the amount of cash that savers can put in tax-free accounts, according to a Treasury minister.
title: UK Considers Reducing Cash Portion of £20,000 ISA Allowance

author: Ana Monteiro
description: President Cyril Ramaphosa struck an upbeat tone before a meeting with US counterpart Donald Trump, which the South African leader hopes will repair frayed ties between the countries.
title: South African President Strikes Upbeat Tone Before Trump Meeting

author: Muyao Shen
description: Controversial crypto entrepreneur Justin Sun announced that he’s joining a high-profile dinner with the US President Donald Trump later this week.
title: Crypto Entrepreneur Justin Sun Will Join Trump’s Memecoin Dinner

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: European and UK officials ratcheted up pressure on Israel over its decision to deepen the military incursion in Gaza, expanding the international outcry over the humanitarian crisis caused by the conflict.
title: European Governments Step Up Pressure on Israel Over Gaza War

author: Fabiola Zerpa, Nick Wadhams
description: The Trump administration is set to extend Chevron Corp.’s deadline to halt its operations in Venezuela by another 60 days as the US continues negotiations with President Nicolas Maduro’s government over repatriation flights and the fate of US detainees in the country, a person familiar with the matter said.
title: US Set to Extend Chevron Venezuela Waiver by Another 60 Days

author: Fred Ojambo
description: Ugandan lawmakers passed a law that will allow military courts to try civilians, just three months after the supreme court ruled that such trials were illegal.
title: Uganda Lawmakers Pass Law to Try Civilians in Military Courts

author: Mark Chediak, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: US duties on solar equipment from four Southeast Asian countries are now set to take effect, following a government trade commission’s conclusion Tuesday the imports threaten domestic manufacturers.
title: US Tariffs on Asian Solar Gear Hit 3,521% After Panel Vote

author: Carolina Millan
description: Two close aides of Mexico City Mayor Clara Brugada were shot dead by assailants on a motorbike, President Claudia Sheinbaum told reporters.
title: Mexico City Mayor’s Aides Shot Dead by Attackers on Motorbikes

author: Alicia A. Caldwell, Fabiola Zerpa, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: Immigration lawyer Jodi Goodwin said her Venezuelan clients for years held onto the idea that their status in the US was stable. They had work permits and paid taxes under a US humanitarian program that offered refuge from turmoil back home.
title: Surprise Supreme Court Ruling Throws 350,000 Migrants Into Uncertainty

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: President Donald Trump is set to make a new announcement on the path forward for his ambitious and controversial plan for a “Golden Dome” missile-defense shield, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Trump Set to Make Announcement on ‘Golden Dome’ Missile Defense

author: Ignacio Olivera Doll
description: The Argentine government dismantled the Investigative Task Force (UTI), a body created just three months ago to investigate the Libra cryptocurrency scandal and the roles of President Javier Milei and his sister Karina, according to a decree published in the official gazette.
title: Milei Shuts Down Argentina Unit Investigating Crypto Scandal

author: Sergio Mendoza
description: Socialist former leader Evo Morales failed to register for Bolivia’s upcoming presidential vote, according to the list of ten candidates published Tuesday by the electoral court.
title: Bolivia Registers 10 Presidential Candidates; Morales Not Included

author: William Selway
description: The UK announced a series of measures to punish Israel over its actions in Gaza, joining the international campaign to ratchet up pressure on Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
title: UK Pauses Israel Trade Talks and Issues Sanctions Over Gaza War

author: Gregory Korte, Bill Allison
description: Elon Musk said he would significantly pull back from political spending, a likely blow to US President Donald Trump and Republicans ahead of the 2026 midterm elections.
title: Musk Says He’ll Scale Back Political Spending in Blow to GOP

author: Natalia Ojewska
description: Poland’s far-right leader Slawomir Mentzen has set out his conditions for endorsing one of the two candidates in a presidential election runoff on June 1 that include ruling out Ukraine’s membership in NATO.
title: Polish Far-Right Kingmaker Sets Terms for Backing Candidates

author: Ailbhe Rea
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves hinted she could change course on cuts to energy subsidies for millions of British pensioners, following newspaper reports of a government U-turn on the divisive policy.
title: Reeves Hints at U-Turn on Winter Fuel Cuts for Pensioners

author: Marc Champion
description: The US president had the means to pressure Putin on Ukraine and didn’t. Now it’s the Old World’s time to choose.
title: Ukraine and Europe Are on Their Own Now

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: The White House’s chief economist dismissed the idea that tariff increases will have a lasting impact on US inflation, and cited the potential for interest rates to get back down to pre-Covid levels.
title: White House’s Miran Dismisses Inflation Risk From Tariff Hikes

author: Tope Alake
description: The prospect of House Republicans’ cuts to electric vehicle subsidies threatens to further dim the outlook.
title: Charging Installations Drop as Trump Ramps Up Attacks on EVs

author: Andrea Palasciano
description: Germany has offered to take the lead on joint European Union projects regarding air defense, land and marine systems, Defense Minister Boris Pistorius said Tuesday, as the bloc ramps up its own military deterrent to Russian aggression.
title: Germany Offers to Take the Lead On Joint EU Air Defense Projects

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: Spanish Foreign Minister Jose Manuel Albares said the European Union should use its economic ties to pressure Israel as it expands its attacks in Gaza, joining a growing international outcry at the humanitarian crisis.
title: Spain Says EU Must Rethink Israel Ties Due to Gaza Attacks

author: Donato Paolo Mancini
description: Pope Leo XIV’s proposed role hosting Ukraine-Russia peace talks in the Vatican marks a significant development for the first US-born pontiff, just as the Trump administration appears to be stepping back from leading negotiations.
title: Trump Draws New Pope Into a Tricky Role on Russia’s War

author: Julian Lee
description: Spoofed positions, missing signals and cargo switches make tracking shipments more complicated
title: Russian Oil Flows Are Becoming Increasingly Obscured

author: Irina Anghel
description: UK Conservative leader Kemi Badenoch is under pressure as a new poll shows her party’s popularity has dropped to the lowest in at least 24 years, sliding to fourth place behind the Liberal Democrats.
title: UK Tories Fall to Fourth Place as Support Hits a Record Low

author: Alberto Nardelli, Andrea Palasciano
description: The European Union has approved its latest sanctions package against Russia, targeting nearly 200 shadow fleet ships as well as addressing hybrid threats and human rights, the bloc’s top diplomat Kaja Kallas announced on Tuesday.
title: EU Adopts Sanctions on Russia’s Shadow Fleet, Hybrid Threats

author: Loni Prinsloo, S'thembile Cele
description: South Africa’s government plans to offer Elon Musk a workaround of local Black ownership laws for his Starlink internet service to operate in the country, aiming to ease tensions with both the billionaire and US President Donald Trump.
title: South Africa to Offer Musk Starlink Deal Before Trump Meeting

author: Beril Akman, Stephanie Flanders
description: Turkey said it expects to reap “huge” economic gains from the Kurdish separatist group’s decision to stop its 40-year war in the country’s southeast.
title: Turkey Sees ‘Huge’ Peace Dividend From End of $1.8 Trillion War

author: Flavia Krause-Jackson
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump Steps Back From Ukraine Peace Process

author: Andrea Palasciano, Jorge Valero
description: The European Union is preparing to lift all remaining economic sanctions against Syria, according to people familiar with the matter, pending formal approval by the bloc’s foreign ministers gathered in Brussels on Tuesday.
title: EU Prepares to Remove Most Remaining Sanctions Against Syria

author: Jonathan Browning
description: A second man was charged in relation to a series of fires in London this month believed to be targeting UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer.
title: Second Man Charged in Connection With Fires Targeting Starmer

author: Arsalan Shahla
description: Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said he doesn’t think negotiations with the US over his country’s nuclear program will succeed and urged the Trump administration to stop “talking nonsense.”
title: Iran’s Khamenei Says US Nuclear Talks Unlikely to Yield Results

author: Fiona MacDonald, Paul Wallace, Joumanna Bercetche
description: Qatar defended its decision to gift a Boeing Co. 747 jumbo jet to the US as a routine transaction between partners, calling criticism of the deal a misguided view of the country as an Arab state trying to gain political influence.
title: Qatar Defends Jet Gift to US, Calls It Normal Transaction

author: Irina Vilcu
description: Romania passed a major test for its young democracy as a centrist independent won the race for president, withstanding a surge of the far right.
title: How Romania Defused Far-Right Threat in Presidential Election

author: Paul Wallace, Joumanna Bercetche, Zainab Fattah
description: Qatar, a key mediator for the war in Gaza, criticized Israel’s latest offensive against Hamas, saying it would prolong the conflict and worsen the humanitarian situation for Palestinians.
title: Qatari Leader Assails Israel Over Gaza Attacks and Lack of Aid

author: Kari Lundgren, Will Mathis
description: The Trump administration’s surprise reversal of an order to halt a $5 billion wind energy project off the coast of New York offered some respite to a beleaguered industry whose future in the US has been in doubt.
title: Trump U-Turn on $5 Billion NY Wind Farm Lifts an Ailing Industry

author: Zoltan Simon
description: Two years after Prime Minister Viktor Orban returned to power in 2010, he told an audience of entrepreneurs that Hungary was a nation that he “hoped to God” wouldn’t one day need to replace democracy. Hungarians are now wondering if their leader is doing just that.
title: Orban Moves to Root Out Dissent a Year Before Hungary’s Election

author: Andras Gergely, Marton Kasnyik
description: Hungarian lawmakers approved the exit from the International Criminal Court, cementing another move by Prime Minister Viktor Orban away from the European mainstream.
title: Hungary’s Lawmakers Back Exit From International Criminal Court

author: Rebecca Choong Wilkins, Colum Murphy, Jing Li
description: China is giving European business leaders its warmest welcome in years, in an effort to strengthen ties as Beijing seeks to counter Donald Trump’s tariff pressure and stabilize its slowing economy.
title: China Gives EU Business Groups High-Level Meetings to Boost Ties

author: Steven T. Dennis, Jack Fitzpatrick
description: House Speaker Mike Johnson emerged from a late-night meeting Monday with holdout Republicans from New York and other high-tax states saying they had made “lots of progress” on a deal over the divisive state and local tax deduction.
title: SALT Agreement Remains Elusive for House GOP on Trump Tax Bill

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand expects to reduce its trade gap with the US by as much as $15 billion annually with its recent initiatives to prevent the misuse of origin rules for exports, according to Finance Minister Pichai Chunhavajira.
title: Thailand Eyes $15 Billion Cut in US Trade Gap With Export Rules

author: Yian Lee, Betty Hou
description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te said his government would set up a sovereign wealth fund to help the archipelago’s companies expand globally, a move that would expand Taipei’s ties to markets around the world and counter China’s attempts to isolate it.
title: Taiwan Plans Wealth Fund to Counter China With Global Expansion

author: Keira Wright
description: Australia’s decades-long Liberal-National tie-up will end after the leader of the National Party, David Littleproud, said his party won’t form another coalition agreement with the Liberal Party.
title: Australia’s Liberal-National Coalition Splits After Decades

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan’s Finance Minister said he’s arranging a bilateral meeting with US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent this week to discuss topics including currency matters, triggering further gains in the yen.
title: Japan’s Kato Plans Bessent Meet to Discuss Topics Including FX

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: Stablecoin legislation overcame a procedural blockade in the US Senate, marking a major victory for the crypto industry after a group of Democrats dropped their opposition Monday.
title: Stablecoin Bill Advances in US Senate in Big Win for Crypto

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: The US Department of State is offering a reward of up to $10 million for information on Hezbollah’s activities and connections in Latin America.
title: US Offers $10 Million for Tips on Hezbollah in Latin America

author: David Voreacos, Chris Strohm, Ellen M Gilmer
description: The Justice Department charged a Democratic House lawmaker from Newark, New Jersey, with assault after a confrontation with US immigration officers on May 9 at a private detention center that is central to President Donald Trump’s plans for mass deportations, a prosecutor said.
title: NJ Congresswoman Charged With Assault in ICE Protest, Prosecutor Says
